trans-unit.source: Generate recommendations using Mahout and Hadoop | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Generate recommendations using Mahout and Hadoop | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Apache Mahout machine learning library to generate movie recommendations with HDInsight (Hadoop).
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Apache Mahout machine learning library to generate movie recommendations with HDInsight (Hadoop).

trans-unit.source: Generate movie recommendations by using Apache Mahout with Hadoop in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Generate movie recommendations by using Apache Mahout with Hadoop in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the [Apache Mahout](http://mahout.apache.org) machine learning library with Azure HDInsight to generate movie recommendations.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the [Apache Mahout](http://mahout.apache.org) machine learning library with Azure HDInsight to generate movie recommendations.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this document require a Windows client and a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this document require a Windows client and a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For information on using Mahout from a Linux, OS X, or Unix client, with a Linux-based HDInsight cluster, see [Generate movie recommendations by using Apache Mahout with Linux-based Hadoop in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-mahout-linux-mac.md)
trans-unit.target: For information on using Mahout from a Linux, OS X, or Unix client, with a Linux-based HDInsight cluster, see [Generate movie recommendations by using Apache Mahout with Linux-based Hadoop in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-mahout-linux-mac.md)

trans-unit.source: What you will learn
trans-unit.target: What you will learn

trans-unit.source: Mahout is a [machine learning][ml] library for Apache Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: Mahout is a [machine learning][ml] library for Apache Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: Mahout contains algorithms for processing data, such as filtering, classification, and clustering.
trans-unit.target: Mahout contains algorithms for processing data, such as filtering, classification, and clustering.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will use a recommendation engine to generate movie recommendations that are based on movies your friends have seen.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will use a recommendation engine to generate movie recommendations that are based on movies your friends have seen.

trans-unit.source: You will also learn how to perform classifications with a decision forest.
trans-unit.target: You will also learn how to perform classifications with a decision forest.

trans-unit.source: This will teach you the following:
trans-unit.target: This will teach you the following:

trans-unit.source: How to run Mahout jobs by using Windows PowerShell
trans-unit.target: How to run Mahout jobs by using Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.source: How to run Mahout jobs from the Hadoop command line
trans-unit.target: How to run Mahout jobs from the Hadoop command line

trans-unit.source: How to install Mahout on HDInsight 3.0 and HDInsight 2.0 clusters
trans-unit.target: How to install Mahout on HDInsight 3.0 and HDInsight 2.0 clusters

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Mahout is provided with the HDInsight 3.1 version of the clusters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Mahout is provided with the HDInsight 3.1 version of the clusters.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an earlier version of HDInsight, see [Install Mahout](#install) before you continue.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an earlier version of HDInsight, see [Install Mahout](#install) before you continue.

trans-unit.source: prerequisites
trans-unit.target: prerequisites

trans-unit.source: **An Windows-based Hadoop cluster in HDInsight**.
trans-unit.target: **An Windows-based Hadoop cluster in HDInsight**.

trans-unit.source: For information about creating one, see [Get started using Hadoop in HDInsight][getstarted]
trans-unit.target: For information about creating one, see [Get started using Hadoop in HDInsight][getstarted]

trans-unit.source: **A workstation with Azure PowerShell**.
trans-unit.target: **A workstation with Azure PowerShell**.

trans-unit.source: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).
trans-unit.target: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).

trans-unit.source: Generate recommendations by using Windows PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Generate recommendations by using Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Although the job used in this section works by using Windows PowerShell, many of the classes provided with Mahout do not currently work with Windows PowerShell, and they must be run by using the Hadoop command line.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Although the job used in this section works by using Windows PowerShell, many of the classes provided with Mahout do not currently work with Windows PowerShell, and they must be run by using the Hadoop command line.

trans-unit.source: For a list of classes that do not work with Windows PowerShell, see the [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting) section.
trans-unit.target: For a list of classes that do not work with Windows PowerShell, see the [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting) section.

trans-unit.source: For an example of using the Hadoop command line to run Mahout jobs, see [Classify data by using the Hadoop command line](#classify).
trans-unit.target: For an example of using the Hadoop command line to run Mahout jobs, see [Classify data by using the Hadoop command line](#classify).

trans-unit.source: One of the functions that is provided by Mahout is a recommendation engine.
trans-unit.target: One of the functions that is provided by Mahout is a recommendation engine.

trans-unit.source: This engine accepts data in the format of `userID`, `itemId`, and `prefValue` (the users preference for the item).
trans-unit.target: This engine accepts data in the format of `userID`, `itemId`, and `prefValue` (the users preference for the item).

trans-unit.source: Mahout can then perform co-occurance analysis to determine: _users who have a preference for an item also have a preference for these other items_.
trans-unit.target: Mahout can then perform co-occurance analysis to determine: _users who have a preference for an item also have a preference for these other items_.

trans-unit.source: Mahout then determines users with like-item preferences, which can be used to make recommendations.
trans-unit.target: Mahout then determines users with like-item preferences, which can be used to make recommendations.

trans-unit.source: The following is an extremely simple example that uses movies:
trans-unit.target: The following is an extremely simple example that uses movies:

trans-unit.source: __Co-occurance__: Joe, Alice, and Bob all liked _Star Wars_, _The Empire Strikes Back_, and _Return of the Jedi_.
trans-unit.target: __Co-occurance__: Joe, Alice, and Bob all liked _Star Wars_, _The Empire Strikes Back_, and _Return of the Jedi_.

trans-unit.source: Mahout determines that users who like any one of these movies also like the other two.
trans-unit.target: Mahout determines that users who like any one of these movies also like the other two.

trans-unit.source: __Co-occurance__: Bob and Alice also liked _The Phantom Menace_, _Attack of the Clones_, and _Revenge of the Sith_.
trans-unit.target: __Co-occurance__: Bob and Alice also liked _The Phantom Menace_, _Attack of the Clones_, and _Revenge of the Sith_.

trans-unit.source: Mahout determines that users who liked the previous three movies also like these three.
trans-unit.target: Mahout determines that users who liked the previous three movies also like these three.

trans-unit.source: __Similarity recommendation__: Because Joe liked the first three movies, Mahout looks at movies that others with similar preferences liked, but Joe has not watched (liked/rated).
trans-unit.target: __Similarity recommendation__: Because Joe liked the first three movies, Mahout looks at movies that others with similar preferences liked, but Joe has not watched (liked/rated).

trans-unit.source: In this case, Mahout recommends _The Phantom Menace_, _Attack of the Clones_, and _Revenge of the Sith_.
trans-unit.target: In this case, Mahout recommends _The Phantom Menace_, _Attack of the Clones_, and _Revenge of the Sith_.

trans-unit.source: Load the data
trans-unit.target: Load the data

trans-unit.source: Conveniently, [GroupLens Research][movielens] provides rating data for movies in a format that is compatible with Mahout.
trans-unit.target: Conveniently, [GroupLens Research][movielens] provides rating data for movies in a format that is compatible with Mahout.

trans-unit.source: Download the [MovieLens 100k][100k] archive, which contains 100,000 ratings from 1000 users for 1700 movies.
trans-unit.target: Download the [MovieLens 100k][100k] archive, which contains 100,000 ratings from 1000 users for 1700 movies.

trans-unit.source: Extract the archive.
trans-unit.target: Extract the archive.

trans-unit.source: It should contain an __ml-100k__ directory, which contains many data files prefixed with __u.__.
trans-unit.target: It should contain an __ml-100k__ directory, which contains many data files prefixed with __u.__.

trans-unit.source: The file that will be analyzed by Mahout is __u.data__.
trans-unit.target: The file that will be analyzed by Mahout is __u.data__.

trans-unit.source: The data structure of this file is `userID`, `movieID`, `userRating`, and `timestamp`.
trans-unit.target: The data structure of this file is `userID`, `movieID`, `userRating`, and `timestamp`.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of the data:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of the data:

trans-unit.source: Upload the __u.data__ file to __example/data/u.data__ in your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Upload the __u.data__ file to __example/data/u.data__ in your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you have [Azure PowerShell][aps], you can use the [HDInsight-Tools][tools] module to upload the file.
trans-unit.target: If you have [Azure PowerShell][aps], you can use the [HDInsight-Tools][tools] module to upload the file.

trans-unit.source: For other ways to upload files, see [Upload data for Hadoop Jobs in HDInsight][upload].
trans-unit.target: For other ways to upload files, see [Upload data for Hadoop Jobs in HDInsight][upload].

trans-unit.source: The following command uses `Add-HDInsightFile` to upload the file:
trans-unit.target: The following command uses `Add-HDInsightFile` to upload the file:

trans-unit.source: This uploads the __u.data__ file to __example/data/u.data__ in the default storage in your cluster.
trans-unit.target: This uploads the __u.data__ file to __example/data/u.data__ in the default storage in your cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can then access this data by using the __wasb:///example/data/u.data__ URI from HDInsight jobs.
trans-unit.target: You can then access this data by using the __wasb:///example/data/u.data__ URI from HDInsight jobs.

trans-unit.source: Run the job
trans-unit.target: Run the job

trans-unit.source: Use the following Windows PowerShell script to run a job that uses the Mahout recommendation engine with the __u.data__ file that you uploaded previously:
trans-unit.target: Use the following Windows PowerShell script to run a job that uses the Mahout recommendation engine with the __u.data__ file that you uploaded previously:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Mahout jobs do not remove temporary data that is created while processing the job.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Mahout jobs do not remove temporary data that is created while processing the job.

trans-unit.source: The `--tempDir` parameter is specified in the example job to isolate the temporary files into a specific path for easy deletion.
trans-unit.target: The `--tempDir` parameter is specified in the example job to isolate the temporary files into a specific path for easy deletion.

trans-unit.source: To remove these files, you can use one of the tools mentioned in [Upload data for Hadoop jobs in HDInsight][upload].
trans-unit.target: To remove these files, you can use one of the tools mentioned in [Upload data for Hadoop jobs in HDInsight][upload].

trans-unit.source: Or you can use the `Remove-HDInsightFile` function in the [HDInsight-Tools][tools] module.
trans-unit.target: Or you can use the `Remove-HDInsightFile` function in the [HDInsight-Tools][tools] module.

trans-unit.source: If you do not remove the temporary files or the output file, you will receive an error message if you run the job again.
trans-unit.target: If you do not remove the temporary files or the output file, you will receive an error message if you run the job again.

trans-unit.source: The Mahout job does not return the output to STDOUT.
trans-unit.target: The Mahout job does not return the output to STDOUT.

trans-unit.source: Instead, it stores it in the specified output directory as __part-r-00000__.
trans-unit.target: Instead, it stores it in the specified output directory as __part-r-00000__.

trans-unit.source: To download and view the file, use the `Get-HDInsightFile` function in the [HDInsight-Tools][tools] module.
trans-unit.target: To download and view the file, use the `Get-HDInsightFile` function in the [HDInsight-Tools][tools] module.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of the content of the file:
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of the content of the file:

trans-unit.source: The first column is the `userID`.
trans-unit.target: The first column is the `userID`.

trans-unit.source: The values contained in '[' and ']' are `movieId`:`recommendationScore`.
trans-unit.target: The values contained in '[' and ']' are `movieId`:`recommendationScore`.

trans-unit.source: View the output
trans-unit.target: View the output

trans-unit.source: Although the generated output might be OK for use in an application, it's not very readable.
trans-unit.target: Although the generated output might be OK for use in an application, it's not very readable.

trans-unit.source: Some of the other files extracted to the __ml-100k__ folder earlier can be used to resolve `movieId` to a movie name, which is what the following PowerShell script does:
trans-unit.target: Some of the other files extracted to the __ml-100k__ folder earlier can be used to resolve `movieId` to a movie name, which is what the following PowerShell script does:

trans-unit.source: To use this script, you must have previously extracted the __ml-100k__ folder, in addition to having a local copy of the __part-r-00000__ output file that was generated by the Mahout job.
trans-unit.target: To use this script, you must have previously extracted the __ml-100k__ folder, in addition to having a local copy of the __part-r-00000__ output file that was generated by the Mahout job.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of running the script:
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of running the script:

trans-unit.target: The output should appear similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Classify data by using the Hadoop command line
trans-unit.target: Classify data by using the Hadoop command line

trans-unit.source: One of the classification methods available with Mahout is to build a [random forest][forest].
trans-unit.target: One of the classification methods available with Mahout is to build a [random forest][forest].

trans-unit.source: This is a multiple step process that involves using training data to generate decision trees, which are then used to classify data.
trans-unit.target: This is a multiple step process that involves using training data to generate decision trees, which are then used to classify data.

trans-unit.source: This uses the __org.apache.mahout.classifier.df.tools.Describe__ class provided by Mahout.
trans-unit.target: This uses the __org.apache.mahout.classifier.df.tools.Describe__ class provided by Mahout.

trans-unit.source: It currently must be run by using the Hadoop command line.
trans-unit.target: It currently must be run by using the Hadoop command line.

trans-unit.source: Load the data
trans-unit.target: Load the data

trans-unit.source: Download the following files from [The NSL-KDD Data Set](http://nsl.cs.unb.ca/NSL-KDD/).
trans-unit.target: Download the following files from [The NSL-KDD Data Set](http://nsl.cs.unb.ca/NSL-KDD/).

trans-unit.source: [KDDTrain+.ARFF](http://nsl.cs.unb.ca/NSL-KDD/KDDTrain+.arff): the training file
trans-unit.target: [KDDTrain+.ARFF](http://nsl.cs.unb.ca/NSL-KDD/KDDTrain+.arff): the training file

trans-unit.source: [KDDTest+.ARFF](http://nsl.cs.unb.ca/NSL-KDD/KDDTest+.arff): the test data
trans-unit.target: [KDDTest+.ARFF](http://nsl.cs.unb.ca/NSL-KDD/KDDTest+.arff): the test data

trans-unit.source: Open each file and remove the lines at the top that begin with '@', and then save the files.
trans-unit.target: Open each file and remove the lines at the top that begin with '@', and then save the files.

trans-unit.source: If these are not removed, you will receive error messages when using this data with Mahout.
trans-unit.target: If these are not removed, you will receive error messages when using this data with Mahout.

trans-unit.source: Upload the files to __example/data__.
trans-unit.target: Upload the files to __example/data__.

trans-unit.source: You can do this by using the `Add-HDInsightFile` function in the [HDInsight-Tools][tools] module.
trans-unit.target: You can do this by using the `Add-HDInsightFile` function in the [HDInsight-Tools][tools] module.

trans-unit.source: Run the job
trans-unit.target: Run the job

trans-unit.source: This job requires the Hadoop command line.
trans-unit.target: This job requires the Hadoop command line.

trans-unit.source: Enable Remote Desktop for the HDInsight cluster, then connect to it by following the instructions at [Connect to HDInsight clusters using RDP](hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal.md#rdp).
trans-unit.target: Enable Remote Desktop for the HDInsight cluster, then connect to it by following the instructions at [Connect to HDInsight clusters using RDP](hdinsight-administer-use-management-portal.md#rdp).

trans-unit.source: After connecting, use the __Hadoop Command Line__ icon to open the Hadoop command line:
trans-unit.target: After connecting, use the __Hadoop Command Line__ icon to open the Hadoop command line:

trans-unit.source: hadoop cli
trans-unit.target: hadoop cli

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to generate the file descriptor (__KDDTrain+.info__), which uses Mahout.
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to generate the file descriptor (__KDDTrain+.info__), which uses Mahout.

trans-unit.source: The `N 3 C 2 N C 4 N C 8 N 2 C 19 N L` describes the attributes of the data in the file.
trans-unit.target: The `N 3 C 2 N C 4 N C 8 N 2 C 19 N L` describes the attributes of the data in the file.

trans-unit.source: For example, L indicates a label.
trans-unit.target: For example, L indicates a label.

trans-unit.source: Build a forest of decision trees by using the following command:
trans-unit.target: Build a forest of decision trees by using the following command:

trans-unit.source: The output of this operation is stored in the __nsl-forest__ directory, which is located in the storage for your HDInsight cluster at __wasb://user/<username>/nsl-forest/nsl-forest.seq.
trans-unit.target: The output of this operation is stored in the __nsl-forest__ directory, which is located in the storage for your HDInsight cluster at __wasb://user/<username>/nsl-forest/nsl-forest.seq.

trans-unit.source: The <username> is the user name that you used for your Remote Desktop session.
trans-unit.target: The <username> is the user name that you used for your Remote Desktop session.

trans-unit.source: This file is not readable by humans.
trans-unit.target: This file is not readable by humans.

trans-unit.source: Test the forest by classifying the __KDDTest+.arff__ dataset.
trans-unit.target: Test the forest by classifying the __KDDTest+.arff__ dataset.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command:

trans-unit.source: This command returns summary information about the classification process similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: This command returns summary information about the classification process similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: This job also produces a file located at __wasb:///example/data/predictions/KDDTest+.arff.out__.
trans-unit.target: This job also produces a file located at __wasb:///example/data/predictions/KDDTest+.arff.out__.

trans-unit.source: However, this file is not readable by humans.
trans-unit.target: However, this file is not readable by humans.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Mahout jobs do not overwrite files.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Mahout jobs do not overwrite files.

trans-unit.source: If you want to run these jobs again, you must delete the files that were created by previous jobs.
trans-unit.target: If you want to run these jobs again, you must delete the files that were created by previous jobs.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: Install Mahout
trans-unit.target: Install Mahout

trans-unit.source: Mahout is installed on HDInsight 3.1 clusters, and it can be installed manually on HDInsight 3.0 or HDInsight 2.1 clusters by using the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Mahout is installed on HDInsight 3.1 clusters, and it can be installed manually on HDInsight 3.0 or HDInsight 2.1 clusters by using the following steps:

trans-unit.source: The version of Mahout to use depends on the HDInsight version of your cluster.
trans-unit.target: The version of Mahout to use depends on the HDInsight version of your cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can find the cluster version by using the following [Azure PowerShell][aps] command:
trans-unit.target: You can find the cluster version by using the following [Azure PowerShell][aps] command:

trans-unit.source: __For HDInsight 2.1__, you can download a Java Archive (JAR) file that contains [Mahout 0.9](http://repo2.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/mahout/mahout-core/0.9/mahout-core-0.9-job.jar).
trans-unit.target: __For HDInsight 2.1__, you can download a Java Archive (JAR) file that contains [Mahout 0.9](http://repo2.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/mahout/mahout-core/0.9/mahout-core-0.9-job.jar).

trans-unit.source: __For HDInsight 3.0__, you must [build Mahout from the source][build] and specify the Hadoop version provided by HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: __For HDInsight 3.0__, you must [build Mahout from the source][build] and specify the Hadoop version provided by HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Install the prerequisites listed on the build page, download the source, and then use the following command to create the Mahout jar files:
trans-unit.target: Install the prerequisites listed on the build page, download the source, and then use the following command to create the Mahout jar files:

trans-unit.source: Upload the jar file to __example/jars__ in the default storage for your cluster.
trans-unit.target: Upload the jar file to __example/jars__ in the default storage for your cluster.

trans-unit.source: The following example uses add-hdinsightfile from the [HDInsight-Tools][tools] to upload the file:
trans-unit.target: The following example uses add-hdinsightfile from the [HDInsight-Tools][tools] to upload the file:

trans-unit.source: Cannot overwrite files
trans-unit.target: Cannot overwrite files

trans-unit.source: Mahout jobs do not clean up temporary files that were created during processing.
trans-unit.target: Mahout jobs do not clean up temporary files that were created during processing.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the jobs will not overwrite an existing output file.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the jobs will not overwrite an existing output file.

trans-unit.source: To avoid errors when running Mahout jobs, delete temporary and output files between runs, or use unique temporary and output directory names.
trans-unit.target: To avoid errors when running Mahout jobs, delete temporary and output files between runs, or use unique temporary and output directory names.

trans-unit.source: Cannot find the JAR file
trans-unit.target: Cannot find the JAR file

trans-unit.source: HDInsight 3.1 clusters include Mahout.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight 3.1 clusters include Mahout.

trans-unit.source: The path and file name include the version number of Mahout that is installed on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The path and file name include the version number of Mahout that is installed on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The Windows PowerShell example script in this tutorial uses a path that is valid as of July 2014, but the version number will change in future updates to HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: The Windows PowerShell example script in this tutorial uses a path that is valid as of July 2014, but the version number will change in future updates to HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: To determine the current path to the Mahout JAR file for your cluster, use the following Windows PowerShell command, and then modify the script to reference the file path that is returned:
trans-unit.target: To determine the current path to the Mahout JAR file for your cluster, use the following Windows PowerShell command, and then modify the script to reference the file path that is returned:

trans-unit.source: Classes that do not work with Windows PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Classes that do not work with Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.target: Mahout jobs that use the following classes return a variety of error messages if they are used from Windows PowerShell:

trans-unit.target: org.apache.mahout.utils.SequenceFileDumper

trans-unit.target: org.apache.mahout.classifier.df.tools.Describe

trans-unit.source: To run jobs that use these classes, connect to the HDInsight cluster, and run the jobs by using the Hadoop command line.
trans-unit.target: To run jobs that use these classes, connect to the HDInsight cluster, and run the jobs by using the Hadoop command line.

trans-unit.source: See [Classify data using the Hadoop command line](#classify) for an example.
trans-unit.target: See [Classify data using the Hadoop command line](#classify) for an example.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps
